article: What to Do When Your Nespresso Machine Has a Flashing Red Light
intro: When your Nespresso coffee machine blinks red, it means that something is blocking the water flow, there’s no water in the water tank, there’s been an electronic error, or your machine is cooling down after it has overheated. Luckily, all of these issues can be fixed in just a few simple steps. Keep reading to learn how to troubleshoot your machine, including how to descale it and reset it to its original factory settings.

points.name: Why is the light on my Nespresso Machine blinking red?

steps.title: Your machine needs to be descaled (cleaned).
steps.subtitle: If the light on your Vertuo Pop or Next blinks orange or changes from orange to white, it may mean your machine . On Vertuo Plus machines, a half-red and half-green or yellow light indicates that it needs to be descaled.
sub-points: Follow the steps below to descale your Nespresso Machine model. For your machine to work normally, descale it every 3 months.
On Vertuo Creatista machines, the Descale Alert orange LED will blink when it needs to be cleaned.

steps.title: Reset your Nespresso machine if no other method works.
steps.subtitle: If your Nespresso machine still blinks red or refuses to brew after you’ve tried all the steps above, you can try to . This will reset all your preprogrammed settings to its original factory settings.
sub-points: Open the machine head, then close it again. Press the button 5 times within 3 seconds.

Press the lever down for 3 seconds to turn the machine off. Push the button and lever down at the same time for 3 seconds. Press the lever 3 times and push the button to confirm.The orange light will blink 3 times in 3 seconds when the reset is complete. When the light turns a steady green, the machine is ready to use.
Press and hold the Milk Temperature button for 10 seconds. All the lights on the machine will flash 5 times to indicate that it’s been reset.

steps.title: Nespresso Vertuo Creatista
steps.subtitle: To descale the Vertuo Creatista machine, you’ll need 2 packets of  or 200 millilitres (14 US tbsp) of white distilled vinegar.
sub-points: Open the machine head, close it, and turn the lever to the locked position. Empty the drip tray and capsule container. Clean the holes in the steam tip with the tool under the water tank.
Pour 2 packets of Nespresso descaling liquid or 200 millilitres (14 US tbsp) of vinegar into the water tank. Fill the tank to the descale line with water, then place it on the machine.
Place an empty cup under the coffee outlet and steam tip. Press the Steam and Milk Temperature buttons at the same time for about 5 seconds.
Press the Steam button to begin the descale cycle. Once the machine is done, empty the cup. Wash the drip tray and water tank with dish soap and water.
Fill the water tank to the descale line with fresh water, then reattach it to the machine along with the drip tray. Place the cup back under the coffee outlet.
Press the Steam button to begin the rinse cycle. When it’s done, empty and rinse the water tank and drip tray. Let the machine dry completely before using it again.

points.name: What do you do if your Nespresso machine still blinks red?

steps.title: Contact .
steps.subtitle: If you’ve run through all the troubleshooting tips, descaled, and factory reset your Nespresso machine, the next step is to call customer support at 800-562-1465.
sub-points: Nespresso also has a live chat option, which is available from 8 am to 10 pm (Eastern Standard Time) all 7 days of the week.
